item.title: Parked on blind bend of the lane, 18th June
item.description:
This car was parked in the early hours of 28/06/25 and is causing a problem with traffic in both directions as this is on the bend of Burnt Oak lane just before the turning of Cedar Avenue. There have been a few near head in collisions due to the way this car is parked. A neighbour at 269 Burnt Oak lane narrowly avoided a collision whilst exiting her driveway due to restricted view of the road caused by this car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Cedar Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe diversion due to roadworks, 18th June
item.description:
Due to the roadworks closing sections of the A2218, traffic is being diverted down Worsley Bridge Rd and into Meadowview Road. This is a very narrow road and due to parked cars (especially close to the corner) it is very hazardous - traffic gets blocked up and cannot get through, leading to several near-misses. It is now 10.42 pm and there is still a constant stream of traffic with repeated blaring of car horns due to driver frustration. This is unacceptable. An alternative diversion needs to be arranged and clearly sign-posted. (It does not help that multiple sections of simultaneous roadworks have been approved, which causes absolute mayhem.)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worsley Bridge Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: A-board and freestanding menu display placed otherwise than adjoining the premises frontage and not within the permitted footway seating area at Moon bar and restaurant 59-63 High St, Beckenham., 18th June
item.description:
A-board and freestanding menu display placed otherwise than adjoining the premises frontage and not within the permitted footway seating area at Moon bar and restaurant 59-63 High St, Beckenham. This is a narrow and busy footway already with a bus shelter and trees. It also gives the impression of the premises 'owning' the footway. I have even seen staff emptying waste into the council public litter bin nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very smelly drain on Portland Street, opposite no. 7 SE17 2PF, 18th June
item.description:
Thames Water investigated a consistently smelly drain outside no. 7 Portland street but said it was a council issue, not theirs, as the smell is omitting from a drain on the highway - not from a house. Please can somebody investigate this, as this smell has been present for some time. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
